title: Typed JSON Export Format
description: Schema for the typed-JSON export format used by the Lua game data exporter. This format preserves Lua type information, particularly distinguishing integers from floats.

row.description: A row in the exported data (header row or data row)

typed_value.description: A typed value that preserves Lua type information

plain_number.description: A plain JSON number (used for non-integer floats)

typed_integer.description: An integer wrapped as {"int": "N"} to preserve integer type

typed_special_float.description: Special float values (nan, inf, -inf) that cannot be represented in standard JSON

typed_table.description: A Lua table encoded as [size, elem1, ..., elemN, [key1,val1], ...]. The first element is the sequence size (plain integer). Sequence elements follow, then key-value pairs as 2-element arrays.

prefixItems.description: Sequence size (number of sequential elements starting at index 1)

key_value_pair.description: A key-value pair represented as a 2-element array [key, value]
